Type.Name: BitArray

TypeSignature.Value: public sealed class BitArray : ICloneable, System.Collections.ICollection

Type.ThreadSafetyStatement: Gtk# is thread aware, but not thread safe; See the <link location="node:gtk-sharp/programming/threads">Gtk# Thread Programming</link> for details.

Docs.summary: The BItArray class implements a collection of Boolean values. There are several different constructors for initializing a new BitArray object.
Docs.remarks: The implements an array of Boolean values as a collection. A BitArray can be resized by setting the property.

Docs.summary: Constructs and initializes a new instance of the class where the inital values are set by the array.

remarks.para: The size of the new BItArray will be the same as the Length of the Boolean array.
Compiling and running the above example generates the following output:

Docs.summary: Constructs and initializes a new instance of the class where the inital values are set by the array.

remarks.para: When using this constructor the new instance will allows have a Count that is 8 (i.e. the length of 1 Byte) times the length of the Byte array.
Compiling and running the above example generates the following output:

summary.para: Constructs and initializes a new instance of the class from an existing .

remarks.para: Compiling and running the above example generates the following output:

Docs.param: The Length (Count) of the new BItArray.
Docs.summary: Constructs and initializes a new instance of the class with the specified Count and where the inital values are all set to false.

remarks.para: The initial value of all Bits is false.
Compiling and running the above example generates the following output:

Docs.param: To be added: an object of type 'int []'

summary.para: Constructs and initializes a instance of the class from an array of ints. The first value in the int array sets the leaset significant bits of the bit array.

remarks.para: The int at index 0 of the int array sets the least significant bits of the . The bits of the are set using the two's complement value of the integers.
Compiling and running the above example generates the following output:

Docs.param: The Length (Count) of the new BItArray.
The initial value of all Bits.
Docs.summary: Constructs and initializes a new instance of the class with the specified Count and all values initialized to either true or false.

remarks.para: Compiling and running the above example generates the following output:

Docs.param: The to And with the current instance.
Docs.summary: Performs a bitwise And on two instances.
Docs.returns: A BitAray whose bit values are the bitwise And of the BItArray instance and the argument BitArray.

remarks.para: The result of the And operation overwrites the original instance.
The two BitArrays must be the same length. If they are not an will be thrown.
Compiling and running the above example generates the following output:

summary.para: Returns a that is a copy of the current instance.

returns.para: A that is a copy of the current instance.

MemberSignature.Value: public void CopyTo (Array array, int index);

Docs.param: The one-dimensional that is the destination of the elements copied from the current instance. The of this array is greater than or equal to the sum of and the of the current instance.
A that specifies the first index of to which the elements of the current instance are copied. This value is greater than or equal to zero, and less than .Length.

summary.para: Copies the elements from the current instance to the specified , starting at the specified index of the array.

Docs.summary: Gets the number of elements contained in the current instance.

value.para: A that specifies the number of elements contained in the current instance.

remarks.para: This property is read-only.
is the number of elements that are contained by the .
The is equal to .

para.block: This property is implemented to support the interface.

Docs.param: The index of the element to return.
Docs.summary: Get the specified element from the .
Docs.returns: Returns the value of the specified element.
Docs.remarks: If the index is out of range a will be thrown.

summary.para: Returns an for the current instance.
Gets a value indicating whether the current instance is read-only.

value.para: The value of this property is always false.

summary.para: Gets a value indicating whether access to the current instance is synchronized (thread-safe).

value.para: The value of this property is always false.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool this[int index] { set; get; }

Docs.param: A that specifies the zero-based index of the element in the current instance to get or set. This value must be greater than or equal to 0, and less than the of the current instance.

summary.para: Gets or sets the element at the specified index of the current instance.

value.para: The element at the specified index of the current instance.

Docs.summary: Gets or Sets the number of elements contained in the current instance. Setting the Length causes the BitArray to be resized.

value.para: A that specifies the number of elements contained in the current instance.

remarks.para: is the number of elements that are contained by the .
The is equal to .

Docs.summary: Negates all of the bits in a .
Docs.returns: A BitAray whose bit values are the negation of the BItArray instance.

remarks.para: The result of the Not operation overwrites the original instance.
Compiling and running the above example generates the following output:

Docs.param: The to Or with the current instance.
Docs.summary: Performs a bitwise Or of two instances.
Docs.returns: A BitAray whose bit values are the bitwise Or of the BItArray instance and the argument BitArray.

remarks.para: The result of the Or operation overwrites the original instance.
The two BitArrays must be the same length. If they are not an will be thrown.
Compiling and running the above example generates the following output:

MemberSignature.Value: public void Set (int index, bool value);

Docs.param: The index of the element to be set.
The value to set the indexed element to.
Docs.summary: Sets the specified element of the to the value specified.
Docs.remarks: If the index is out of range a will be thrown.

Docs.param: true or false, all elements of the will be set to this value.
Docs.summary: Sets all the elements of the to either true or false.

summary.para: Gets an object that can be used to synchronize access to the current instance.

value.para: A that can be used to synchronize access to the current instance.

remarks.para: An instance of the class should be synchronized using this property and not directly using the instance. Using this property ensures the correct operation of derived classes.

Docs.param: The to Xor with the current instance.
Docs.summary: Performs a bitwise Xor of two BitArray instances.
Docs.returns: A BitAray whose bit values are the bitwise Xor of the BItArray instance and the argument BitArray.

remarks.para: The result of the Xor operation overwrites the original instance.
The two BitArrays must be the same length. If they are not an will be thrown.
